res://GeneratedLevels/level_1.tscn:
[b]Welcome to the Self-Driving Car Coding Adventure![/b]

In this game, you'll learn to write code to control your car through various levels.

Use the [color=#80CCFF]Code Editor[/color] to write instructions for your car.

For example, try typing:
[code]drive()[/code]
and then click [color=#80CCFF]Run[/color] to move your car forward in the direction it's facing.

The basic commands you can use are:
[code]drive()[/code] - Move forward in the direction you're facing
[code]turn_left()[/code] - Rotate 90° counter-clockwise
[code]turn_right()[/code] - Rotate 90° clockwise

Try to reach the [color=#FFCC80]door[/color] to advance to the next level.

Good luck on your coding journey!
res://GeneratedLevels/level_2.tscn:
[b]Level 2: Variables & Direction[/b]

Now let's learn about variables. Variables let you store and reuse values.

Try creating a variable to store how many steps to move:
[code]var steps = 3
for i in range(steps):
    drive()[/code]

You can also create loops with turning:
[code]for i in range(4):
    drive()
    turn_right()[/code]
Use variables to make your code cleaner and more flexible!
res://GeneratedLevels/level_3.tscn:
[b]Level 3: Loops & Navigation[/b]

Loops let you repeat code multiple times without writing it again and again.

Try making the car drive in a square pattern:
[code]for i in range(4):
    drive()
    turn_right()[/code]

You can also use a [color=#80CCFF]while loop[/color]:
[code]var steps = 0
while steps < 3:
    drive()
    steps = steps + 1[/code]
Try to navigate to the exit with as few lines of code as possible!
res://GeneratedLevels/level_4.tscn:
[b]Level 4: Functions[/b]

Functions let you group code that belongs together.

Define a function like this:
[code]func drive_square():
    for i in range(4):
        drive()
        turn_right()[/code]
Try creating functions for different driving patterns to navigate this complex maze!
